info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:25PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR OAKLAND AND MACOMB COUNTIES... At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Clinton, or near Warren, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... St. Clair Shores and Mount Clemens around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Franklin, Keego Harbor, Waterford, Orchard Lake, Roseville, Shelby Township, Commerce, Ray Center, Utica and Washington. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
